qas.question: In what year was Queen's first album released?
What was the name of Queen's first album?
What was the lead single from Queen's first album?
Which Queen song ranked as the 31st greatest guitar song in a 1998 Rolling Stone article?
Which critic called Queen's debut superb?

context: In July <a0_0>1973<a0_0/>, <a1_0>Queen<a1_0/> finally under a Trident/EMI deal released their eponymous debut album, an effort influenced by the heavy metal and progressive rock of the day. The album was received well by critics; <a4_0>Gordon Fletcher<a4_0/> of Rolling Stone said "their debut album is superb", and Chicago's Daily Herald called it an "above average debut". It drew little mainstream attention, and the lead single "<a2_0>Keep Yourself Alive<a2_0/>", a Brian May composition, sold poorly. Retrospectively, "<a3_0>Keep Yourself Alive<a3_0/>" is cited as the highlight of the album, and in 2008 Rolling Stone ranked it 31st in the "100 Greatest Guitar Songs of All Time", describing it as "an entire album's worth of riffs crammed into a single song". The album was certified gold in the UK and the US.
